label: A2BC7D2_tP24_113_e_a_cef_e-001
title: Akermanite (Ca$_{2}$MgSi$_{2}$O$_{7}$, $S5_{3}$) Structure
comments:
Akermanite is an end point of the mineral melilite, which, like \href{current_web_home_dir/A7B2C2_mC22_12_aij_h_i-001}{thortveitite (S2$_{1}$)}, is a sorosilicate, a mineral containing isolated Si$_{2}$O$_{7}$ or related groups.  We have followed (Parth\'{e}, 1997) and use akermanite to represent the entire class of materials. 
 When the oxygen atoms on the (4e) and (8f) sites are replaced by sulfur this becomes the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B2CD6E_tP24_113_e_e_c_ef_a-001}{Ba$_{2}$ZnGe$_{2}$S$_{6}$O structure}. 
 We use the ambient pressure data from (Yang, 1997) to describe the structure.
